musicalLanguage.description: A flowing piece that captures the movement of water over smooth stones. The right hand plays continuous sixteenth-note arpeggios that ripple across the keyboard while the left hand provides a deep, anchoring bass line.
keyMoments: Continuous water-like flow begins in measure 1
teachingGoals: Practice sustaining a flowing texture while the bass moves independently
styleTips: Keep the right hand perfectly even â€” the water flows without interruption
Pedal changes on each new harmony to keep the stream clear
